verses.text: But speak thou \add the things\add* which become sound doctrine:
that the aged men be sober, grave, temperate, sound in faith, in charity, in patience.
The aged women likewise, \add that they be\add* in behaviour as becometh holiness, not false accusers, not given to much wine, teachers of good things;
that they may teach the young \add women\add* to be sober, to love their husbands, to love their children,
\add to be\add* discreet, chaste, keepers at home, good, obedient to their own husbands, that the word of God be not blasphemed.
Young \add men\add* likewise exhort to be sober minded.
In all \add things\add* shewing thyself a pattern of good works: in doctrine \add shewing\add* uncorruptness, gravity, sincerity,
sound speech that cannot be condemned; that he that is of the contrary \add part\add* may be ashamed, having no evil \add thing\add* to say of you.
\add Exhort\add* servants to be obedient unto their own masters, \add and\add* to please \add them\add* well in all \add things;\add* not answering again;
not purloining, but shewing all good fidelity; that they may adorn the doctrine of God our Saviour in all \add things\add*.
For the grace of God that bringeth salvation hath appeared to all men,
teaching us that denying ungodliness and worldly lusts we should live soberly, righteously, and godly, in \add this\add* present world;
looking for \add that\add* blessed hope, and the glorious appearing of the great God and our Saviour Jesus Christ;
who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all iniquity, and purify unto himself a peculiar people, zealous of good works.
These \add things\add* speak, and exhort, and rebuke with all authority. Let no \add man\add* despise thee.
